Title: Tamala Park Waste Management Centre - Rubbish Tip
Content:
The City of Canning Waste Transfer Station allows for quick and easy disposal of material from cars or trailers on a user pays basis, with residents receiving discounted fees.

The Waste Transfer Station can take waste from both residents and the commercial sector. Inert material taken through the transfer station is separated into metal material, plus building construction material such as rubble, bricks, concrete and sand and other material. Metal and building construction material is recycled, reducing the amount of waste going to landfill.

It is also a one-stop facility for disposal of Household Hazardous Waste (including batteries, aerosols, paint and chemicals) free of charge up to 20L/20kg per person. Residents have access to limited disposal of asbestos, which attracts a fee.
address: Wanneroo City Tamala Park Rubbish Disposal Site, 1700 Marmion Ave, Tamala Park WA 6030, Australia

Title: Armadale Landfill - Hilbert - Rubbish Tip
Content: Opening hours: The facility is open from 8am to 4.45pm, seven days a week and is closed New Year’s Day, Good Friday and Christmas Day. The facility closes at noon on Christmas Eve (24 December) and New Years Eve (31 December). Accepted items General rubbish Greenwaste Recyclables Tyres (small quantities) Car bodies Low level hazardous waste Household chemicals – maximum 20 litres or 20kg Asbestos (only if packaged and wrapped to the prescribed standard). Dispose of your recyclables for free If your load only contains the following it will be free: Whitegoods, eg fridges, freezers and washing machines Scrap metal including small amounts of wire, rinsed steel and aluminium cans Car batteries Cardboard, packing boxes, magazines, newspapers (must be flattened and clean) Glass bottles Small household appliances (e.g. kettles, toasters, hairdryers, stereos) Computers and televisions (Maximum 4 screens) Important notes Loads that contain any other materials will be charged at the standard rate. Green waste and brick rubble are not free items and will be charged. Residential loads only - commercial loads will not be accepted. Metal drums must have the lids removed. Why are only some recyclables accepted for free? The City can cover the cost of handling items such as steel and aluminium by reselling them. Items such as green waste and rubble are costly to process and have little or no resale value and therefore cannot be accepted for free.
address: 145 Hopkinson Rd, Hilbert WA 6112, Australia

Title: Brajkovich Demolition and Salvage - Upper Swan - Rubbish Tip
Content:
Landfills are a needed part of modern life, but they don’t have to drastically impact the future. Our goal is to leave land fit for future development by placing waste, which has been recycled and cannot be pushed back out to market for sustainable reuse, into the landfill to eventually rehabilitate the land.

Safety is our top priority on any demolition we undertake. With more than 40 years of experience, we know how to keep our crew and the public safe during this process. From stringent preventative measures to proper procedures in case of emergencies, we make sure nothing is overlooked.
address: 1686 Great Northern Hwy, Upper Swan WA 6069, Australia

Title: Henderson Waste Recovery Park - Rubbish Tip
Content: The park is open seven days a week, every day of the year except Christmas Day, New Year’s Day and Good Friday. Opening hours are: Domestic Waste Drop-Off / Transfer station: 8am to 4.30pm for cars and trailers Gates close at 4.30pm Trucks on weighbridge: 7am to 4pm from Monday to Saturday 8am to 4pm on Sundays Reuse shop: 8am – 4pm (enter by 3.45pm) Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Public Holidays. Important notes: Fees may be subject to change. Each load will be assessed by the weighbridge attendant whose decision shall be final. Due to safety concerns vehicles with pets will NOT be admitted. The park accepts: General household including furniture, whitegoods and electronics General commercial waste Construction and demolition waste Metal Timber Green Waste (this is processed into mulch which is free to people visiting the park) Polystyrene - no trailer pass required Cardboard - no trailer pass required E-Waste (e.g. computer, keyboard, laptop, phone, TV) - no trailer pass required The above items are recycled or reused wherever possible. Non-commercial cardboard and polystyrene can be delivered by residents and non-residents for free at HWRP, no trailer pass is required.
Rubbish Tip Locations - Accepted Materia: Asbestos|Batteries|Cars & Other Vehicles|Chemicals & Liquids|Clothes & Textiles|Construction Material|Electronics|Furniture|Green Waste|Hazardous Waste|Metals|Paper & Cardboard|Plastics|Rubber
address: 920 Rockingham Rd, Henderson WA 6166, Australia

Title: Red Hill Waste Management Facility - Rubbish Tip
Content:
The EMRC operates the Red Hill Waste Management Facility on behalf of five member Councils - Town of Bassendean, City of Bayswater, City of Kalamunda, Shire of Mundaring and City of Swan.

Located about 12 kilometres north-east of Midland, on the south side of Toodyay Road and east of the Darling escarpment, the Facility uses modern techniques and principles of sanitary landfill design and operation, including leachate collection and methane gas capture.

If you have any queries or require further information, please contact the Red Hill Waste Management Facility on 9574 6235 or redhill@emrc.org.au.
Rubbish Tip Locations - Accepted Materia: Asbestos|Batteries|Cars & Other Vehicles|Chemicals & Liquids|Clothes & Textiles|Construction Material|Electronics|Furniture|Green Waste|Hazardous Waste|Metals|Paper & Cardboard|Plastics|Rubber
address: 1094 Toodyay Rd, Red Hill WA 6056, Australia

Title: Wolfram Metal Recyclers - Port Kennedy - Recycling Centre
Content:
Wolfram Metal Recyclers, is a Perth based scrap metal recycling yard, with 45 years of experience within the scrap metal industry. WMR is a privately-owned scrap metal recycling business founded by Brett Russell.
Wolfram Metal Recyclers buys all metals and specialise in Tungsten, Titanium, Nickel Alloys & Stainless Steel. We provide reliable and trustworthy service to everyone.

Wolfram cater to everyone’s needs, providing:

Weigh & Pay service to all Plumbers, Electricians, Mechanics, ETC (this also includes general public).
One of our friendly staff members will come to your home or business and weigh your scrap metal in front of you, we will then pay cash in hand on the day.
Wolfram can also provide semi-trucks and flat top truck for loads that are unable to fit into our bins.
We also have a wide range of bins from different sizes for everyone’s scrap metal needs.
White goods disposal (NO Pickup).
Automotive batteries and any other scrap metal (ferrous and non-ferrous metals).
Offering local, national and international buy and sell of scrap metal.
Wolfram Metal Recyclers is a versatile Perth based company, which operates locally, nationally and overseas.

In 2017, we opened our first yard, now customers are welcome to bring Scrap Metal to us. We are located in the industrial area of Port Kennedy and offer buy and sell services for scrap metal in Perth, Australia and overseas.

Our service is 100% guaranteed and always reliable.
address: 3 Bessemer Rd, Port Kennedy WA 6172, Australia

Title: West Metro Recycling - Shenton Park - Recycling Centre
Content: To help you manage your waste wisely, the WMRC provides comprehensive waste recycling, treatment and disposal services for acceptable items, seven days a week, for residents, businesses and councils. In its capacity as a transfer station, the West Metro Recycling Centre aggregates, compacts and loads large volumes of municipal solid waste into silos for effective and efficient transfer to distant sites for appropriate treatment or disposal.

Title: Fremantle Recycling Centre
Content:
Entry to Fremantle Recycling Centre

Fremantle Recycling Centre is free to all City of Fremantle and Town of East Fremantle residents with presentation of a photo ID showing your residential address (e.g. driver’s license). If your photo ID does not contain your current residential address, please also bring a rates notice or a bill to verify residency.

**Town of East Fremantle residents will also need to bring their bulk drop-off letter to drop off bulky items.**
Entry passes are now digital for City of Fremantle Residents
City of Fremantle residents can visit the Fremantle Recycling Centre with proof of residency (ie: driver's license and utility bill) to claim their entry pass. No voucher letter is required. Staff will record entries on our new app. This will alleviate issues with lost letters and reduce paper usage.

In addition to recyclable materials, residents are entitled to four (4) drop-offs of household bulk waste per year. Entry passes are for residential properties only and are restricted to one box trailer per pass.

Location and opening hours
The Fremantle Recycling Centre is located at 19A Montreal Street, Fremantle.

Open hours:

Fridays: 12–4pm (Re-use Shop open)
Saturday and Sunday: 8am–4pm (Re-use Shop open)

The recycling centre is closed on public holidays.
Rubbish Tip Locations - Accepted Materia: Batteries|Cars & Other Vehicles|Chemicals & Liquids|Clothes & Textiles|Electronics|Furniture|Green Waste|Metals|Paper & Cardboard|Plastics|Rubber
address: 19a Montreal St, Fremantle WA 6160, Australia

Content:

These sites provide crucial infrastructure for the management and supervision of our collection operations including administration, maintenance, container storage and preparation, vehicle wash down and refuelling facilities.

Some SUEZ service centres also provide fundamental recycling activities such as paper & cardboard baling or act as a transition point for other recyclable materials.

Title: SUEZ Bibra Lake Resource Recovery Park - Transfer Station
Content:
*This site is not open to the public.

Our modern recycling centre was built using state-of-art technology to ensure the maximum recovery of recyclables. The MRF can process up to 30 tonnes per hour - that is equivalent to four full recycling trucks.

The Recycling Centre accepts ‘mixed recycling’ (i.e. mixed plastic and cardboard containers, cans and bottles).

That makes recycling easier for everyone, as recyclables don’t need to be separated for collection.

Collection trucks bring recyclables to our recycling centre in Bibra Lake, 20km south of the Perth CBD. The recyclables are unloaded into an area called the “tipping floor”.

From the tipping floor, recycling is placed onto a conveyor belt to commence processing. Recycling is then sorted by MRF machinery or by hand into “material streams” of:
address: 65 Howson Way, Bibra Lake WA 6163, Australia

Title: REminda WA - Reuse Centre - West Perth - Recycling Centre
Content:
Wherever possible, we support the responsible disposal of unwanted items.

Here are some questions to help you decide if the item is a potential REmida resource.

​

- Can it be directly-repurposed into a classroom setting?

- Does it require a lot of cleaning before it can be used and, if so, am I willing to clean it so REmida doesn't have to?

- Would I give the item to my kids to play with or use?

- Does the item fall into an arts and craft category?

- Can I see something like my item when I look at the materials pictures?

Have I emailed REmida to see if they can either take the item or point me in the right direction?

Title: Cleanaway Dandenong SEMTS – South East Melbourne Transfer Station - Dandenong South
Content:
Cleanaway Dandenong South is a commercial drop off and disposal site, accepting waste from businesses and industrial facilities only.

We accept general waste, construction and demolition waste and timber. All waste types are rated and charged on entry. Medium-density fibreboard and construction and demolition waste are charged at inert waste rates.

As part of Cleanaway’s commitment to resource recovery, we are proud to separate waste material for recycling and divert it away from landfill wherever possible. Speak to us for a quote or find out more information about our products and services.

Title: City of South Perth Recycling Centre - Como - Transfer Station
Content:
As part of the annual rubbish levy, residential ratepayers receive three entry vouchers for the Recycling Centre. These are sent out at the beginning of each financial year with the rates notices.

The vouchers entitle the residential ratepayer to dispose of two payloads of green waste and one payload of general waste per year.

To use, tear off the whole entry voucher and present it in full to the attendant at the Recycling Centre.

Please note the following:

Your assessment number and barcode is printed on the entry voucher
Once you have used your voucher you will not be able to get a second voucher
You will not be able to receive a replacement voucher if it is lost. Please keep it in a safe place
Occupiers who are not owners or do not pay a rubbish levy are not entitled to receive an entry voucher
Occupiers will need to obtain the voucher from the property owner or pay to use the Recycling Centre
Only valid entry vouchers will be accepted.
The gate attendant’s assessment of the voucher and load will be final.
address: Corner Thelma St and, Hayman Rd, Como WA 6152, Australia

Title: Cleanaway Erskine Park Transfer Station
Content:
The Erskine Park Transfer Station separates recyclable materials from the waste streams to be managed as a commodity. The facility serves the Sydney Metropolitan area and is expected to divert up to 40% of the waste streams from landfill and into a recycling facility.

The transfer station is located in the key growth areas surrounding the M7/M4 corridors, and is perfectly positioned just minutes away from the site of Sydney’s second airport at Badgery’s Creek. The site is available to all our commercial partners ranging from demolition companies to commercial & industrial collections businesses, as well as municipal clients.

Call us on 02 9834 0400 to arrange a free consultation, or to find out more about our products, services and pricing.
address: 85-87 Quarry Rd, Erskine Park NSW 2759, Australia

Title: Cleanaway Hallam Transfer Station
Content:
Cleanaway Hallam Transfer Station is part of the Victoria Commingled Resource Recovery (VCRR) network of assets acquired from SKM Recycling in October 2019. The facility is a drop off and disposal site where commercial and municipal recycling is collected for further processing. The site has been upgraded for the safety and protection of our teams and visitors including civil works to ensure regulatory compliance.

We are committed to helping our councils, customers, and local communities recycle right through our online recycling education, community programs and bin signage.
address: 39 Wedgewood Rd, Hallam VIC 3803, Australia

As part of Cleanaway’s commitment to resource recovery, we are proud to separate waste material for recycling wherever possible so that you can do your bit for sustainability. Talk to us for a free consultation, or to find out more about our products and services.

Free items

X-rays *

Buy Crushed Concrete & Aggregates
Recycled Material Delivery
Resource Recovery Facility, St Ives Sydney
Tip off waste materials or pick up quality recycled products & landscape supplies at Greenwood Landfill & Waste Recovery Facility, St Ives. Buy bulk landscaping supplies at wholesale prices. Davis Earthmoving offers truck delivery for recycled materials in load sizes of 2 tonne up to 36 tonne and bulk haulage available.

Our aim is to process various waste materials and recycle resources to create environmentally sustainable products for beneficial re-use and re-sale. Davis Earthmoving is contributing to the circular economy by specialising in recovering resources for a sustainable earth. By choosing recycled products you are joining our community who are committed to waste minimisation.
address: 447 Mona Vale Rd, St Ives NSW 2075, Australia

Title: Nudgee Beach Transfer Station
Content:
How to use the centres
As you enter a resource recovery centre, you will be asked what types of materials you have for recycling or disposal. The attendant will direct you to the appropriate areas. All domestic recyclable materials are processed for free.

If you only have recyclable items or tip shop donations, go to the free recycling area and sort your materials into the correct collection point.

If you have free recycling and green or general waste:

Go to the free recycling area first then drive to a second weighbridge that leads to the other disposal areas. All materials unloaded after the second weighbridge will attract fees or waste vouchers.
If you only have green or general waste (no recycling), go directly to the disposal areas, where all materials will attract fees or waste vouchers.

Waste vouchers, fees and charges
To dispose of general waste or green waste, fees apply, or you can use your waste vouchers. Recycling for vehicles under 4.5 tonnes Combined Gross Vehicle Mass (CGVM) is free.

Recycling
If your vehicle is less than 4.5 tonnes CGVM, you can use the recycling areas at our resource recovery centres for free.

General waste
Waste vouchers or fees apply to dispose of general waste at a resource recovery centre.

Green waste
Waste vouchers or fees apply to dispose of green waste to be recycled. Green waste material comes from the garden. Items include branches, palm fronds, weeds, tree and shrub prunings, loose bark and grass clippings.

Council offers free green waste recycling drop-off weekends to help residents clean up their gardens. Here's our list of upcoming green waste recycling drop-off events.

Safety
When visiting the resource recovery centres, dress for safety. Council recommends fully enclosed shoes, long pants, protective glasses such as sunglasses and protective gloves. Children under 12 and family pets must remain in your vehicle at all times. For heavy loads, bring a friend or family member to help you unload.

Council's resource recovery centres are non-smoking sites.
address: 1372 Nudgee Rd, Nudgee QLD 4014, Australia

Title: Riverview Recycling and Refuse Centre - Ipswich - Rubbish Tip
Content:
Fees and charges
The charges for each centre are as follows:

At Riverview Recycling and Refuse Centre the minimum charge for disposal of general waste by a resident of Ipswich City is $12.00 for up to 500 kilograms. Any quantity of waste in excess of 500 kilograms is charged at $0.20 per kilogram.

At Rosewood Recycling and Refuse Centre the minimum charge for disposal of general waste by a resident of Ipswich is $12.00 for the first two cubic metres. Any waste in excess of two cubic metres is charged at $70 per cubic metre or part thereof.

Also please note that approved recyclable items may be deposited at no cost provided that there is no waste material in the load.

For more information, see Ipswich City Council Fees and Charges or contact Ipswich City Council on (07)3810 6666 or email council@ipswich.qld.gov.au
For information on commercial charges please contact Ipswich City Council.
Waste Acceptance
Both facilities accept dry non-hazardous waste.
No food waste or liquids (other than recyclable/hazardous liquids listed below).
Food and waste doors must be removed from refrigerators and other appliances to prevent small children becoming trapped.
All waste must be covered to prevent littering.
The waste pit (or bins at the Rosewood Recycling and Refuse Centre) are only provided for the disposal of material that cannot be recycled - so sort your waste prior to arriving at recycling and refuse centres.
Ammunition and flares must not be disposed of in the pit. Please refer to Council's information on household hazardous waste for correct disposal techniques.
Ipswich City Council no longer accepts chemicals and gas cylinders on a daily basis at its public waste disposal facilities due to safety and environmental concerns. Council is providing an alternative disposal option for Ipswich residents with scheduled drop-off days to safely dispose of these items. Please refer to council's information on household hazardous waste for the next free chemicals and listed items drop off day.
Recycling Facilities
At both Riverview and Rosewood Recycling and Refuse Centres there are designated areas provided for recycling of:

Green waste and untreated timber: tree prunings, cuttings, branches, stumps, grass clippings and timber are collected for mulching (charges apply).
White goods such as fridges, freezers and other electrical items (food and waste doors must be removed)
Tyres (domestic sources only - charges apply)
Car Batteries (domestic sources only)
Oil (domestic sources only) - 20L limit at any one time
Steel and scrap metal, including car bodies
Paper and cardboard
Clean glass bottles and jars
Aluminium, including cans
Clean plastic, soft drink and milk bottles no plastic bags
Rubbish Tip Locations - Accepted Materia: Batteries|Cars & Other Vehicles|Clothes & Textiles|Construction Material|Electronics|Green Waste|Metals|Paper & Cardboard|Plastics|Rubber
address: Rubbish Tip, 81 Riverview Rd, Riverview QLD 4303, Australia

At Rosewood Recycling and Refuse Centre the minimum charge for disposal of general waste by a resident of Ipswich is $12.00 for the first two cubic metres. Any waste in excess of two cubic metres is charged at $70 per cubic metre or part thereof.

Title: Kartaway Transfer Station - Newton - Rubbish Tip
Content:
Kartaway disposes of waste responsibly and recycles almost all waste collected
As an environmentally responsible company, providing recycling services that meet green star certification, Kartaway is strongly committed to environmentally sound practices.

Conveniently located within Melbourne and Adelaide, Kartaway’s transfer stations are staffed by friendly and helpful staff, affording a clean, safe location for you to dispose of your waste. With a strong environmental focus on recycling and diversion of waste from landfill, we actively sort and recycle the following waste streams:

Concrete, brick, dirt, asphalt
Timber
Steel
Cardboard
Plastics
Comingle recyclables
E-Waste
Contact our friendly staff on 1300 362 362 to discuss how Kartaway can assist with the waste management of your property, or alternatively use our online form!
address: Virginia Rd & Papagni Ave, Newton SA 5074, Australia

Title: Adelaide Waste and Recycling Centre - North Plympton - Rubbish Tip
Content:
The Adelaide Waste and Recycling Centre (AWRC) are a state of the art resource recovery centre and waste recycling operation, conveniently located at 181 Morphett Road, North Plympton.

Both the commercial services and the waste transfer station are managed by Solo Resource Recovery. We accept all types of commercial and domestic waste including, but not limited to:

General waste

address: 181 Morphett Rd, North Plympton SA 5037, Australia

Title: Newton Recycling Centre
Content:
Newton Recyclers in Newton provides comprehensive recycling services for domestic and commercial clients.

We're able to provide 'On-going' or 'Once off' collections for households and businesses.

Speak to one of our friendly team in Newton today to learn more about how our recycling services can help you manage your waste effectively.

Not sure what to do with those leftover newspapers, magazines or milk cartons? Our recycling centre in Newton collects tonnes of paper, cardboard, metal and plastic every week and helps turns them into usable materials. We’re dedicated to providing you with an affordable recycling service that benefits the environment and community.
address: 6 Antonio Ct, Newton SA 5074, Australia

Title: Metrowaste - Thebarton - Transfer Station
Content:
Metro Waste Adelaide has been an integral part of the community for over 40 years specializing in Waste Management.

With a conveniently located facility in Thebarton we have the capacity to take all commercial and residential waste including asbestos products.

Metro Waste has been at forefront of recycling in Adelaide for decades and we endeavour to recover and recycle everything possible to reduce the impact of landfill.

Reducing our carbon footprint is a priority at Metro Waste Adelaide and we will assist you to ensure all waste items are carefully sorted so we can all play our part in creating a healthy environment.

Metro Waste Adelaide also have a large min-bin business so waste pickups are not a problem – just give us a call and we can discuss what bin suits your needs.

With convenient opening hours we welcome your inquiries and look forward to assisting you with any of your waste and dumping requirements.

Normal Opening Hours -

OPEN:
Mon - Fr: 8am - 4.30pm
Sat: 8am - 4pm
Sun / Public Holidays: 10am - 4pm

* CLOSED:
Good Friday
Chrismas Day and New Year Day
Boxing Day and Easter Sunday

address: 19-25 Murray St, Thebarton SA 5031, Australia

Trucks up to 3 tonne tare are welcome to access both facilities (contact Edinburgh North RRC for exceptions with heavier vehicles).

Title: Uleybury Landfill - Rubbish Tip
Content:
The Uleybury landfill is owned and operated by the Northern Adelaide Waste Management Authority (NAWMA). It is situated on the site of a former quartzite quarry and has been in use since 2005. It is a best-practice landfill (balefill) operation with strict adherence to monitoring and controls, which protect the surrounding environment.

Each year around 86,000 tonnes of household and commercial waste is baled at NAWMA’s Edinburgh North Waste Processing Facility. The bales, which each weigh around 1.5 tonnes, are then transported via purpose-built wing-liner semi-trailers to the landfill site.
address: Uleybury SA 5114, Australia

Title: Cleanaway Lonsdale - Waste and Recycling Depot
Content:
Cleanaway Lonsdale Waste and Recycling Depot (formerly SA Waste) offers complete resource recovery, recycling, and waste management services to residents, industry and councils. Services include general waste collection, builder’s demolition waste, recycling and disposal.

Our Lonsdale dump optimises resource recovery by collecting kerbside materials to be separated for recycling, minimising waste from going to landfill.

Lengths of timber and steel are separated and sorted for recycling.
Unwanted metals are separated and sorted for sale to scrap metal merchants.
Old furniture and household goods are separated and recycled where possible.
Garden organic wastes are separated and prepared for mulching and composting.
Concrete and other building rubble are separated and prepared for crushing and recycling.
Contact us for more information about our Lonsdale dump fees.

We can arrange a free consultation to help you with your waste management. Speak to us for a quote, or to find out more about our products and services.
address: 10 Donegal Rd, Lonsdale SA 5160, Australia

Title: Beverley Recycling and Waste Centre
Content:
The Beverley Recycling and Waste Centre was redeveloped in 2018. It complies with Environment Protection Authority (EPA) and Work Health and Safety requirements.

The new waste centre has a disposal area and a Sort 'n Save recycling process. It's got improved customer service and site safety. You can visit with a car load, trailer load or boot load of waste, recycling and organics.

Costs
See the Beverley Waste and Recycling Centre rates and fees.

Minimum charges will apply. These prices include GST and the $143 per tonne EPA Solid Waste Levy. EFTPOS facilities are available.

What we accept:
cardboard
tyres
steel
mattresses
oils
car batteries
fluorescent tubes
e-waste (TVs and computers)
We also accept:

General waste

This includes the solid component of commercial, industrial, government, public or household waste.

Green Waste

Includes waste from domestic and commercial premises and government/council operations. Segregated, untreated timber can be processed as green waste.

Clean Soil

Soil must be clean free from any contaminants, eg. grass, rock, or any other foreign materials.

Concrete / Rubble / Unclean fill

We accept clean and unclean concrete, rubble, and unclean fill.

Paint

Includes unwanted paint and packaging from both trade and DIY painters. Up to 100 litres per vehicle, per visit, secured in containers of 20 litres or less at no charge.

The Beverley Recycling and Waste Centre is a free Paintback collection point for unwanted paint. Paintback diverts paint from landfill. It recycles steel and plastic packaging, with solvent paint used to replace fossil fuels and water in latex paint re-used in industrial processes. See Paintback's list of eligible products.

What we do not accept:
gas bottles
cement sheeting
vinyl flooring
asbestos
flammable/hazardous liquids
Rubbish Tip Locations - Accepted Materia: Batteries|Cars & Other Vehicles|Clothes & Textiles|Construction Material|Electronics|Furniture|Green Waste|Metals|Paper & Cardboard|Plastics|Rubber
address: 2-4 Toogood Ave, Beverley SA 5009, Australia

Title: Windmill Hill - Totness - Transfer Station
Content:
Accepts
Waste oil (domestic only), car and truck batteries and used LPG gas bottles.

Windmill Hill Transfer Station is now a Paintback collection site which is able to accept unwanted paint and packaging for free. Paintback accepts up to 100 litres per vehicle per visit that's secured in containers of 20 litres or less. The system applies to both residential and trades and paint can be dry or liquid. For more information on Paintback visit www.paintback.com.au

Mulch
Mulch is available for purchase, see fees listed below.

Free Clean Green Waste Days
A number of free clean green waste drop-off days are offered throughout the year. For more information, visit the Free Clean Green Waste Drop-off Day page.

Title: Launceston Waste Centre and Transfer Station
Content: Opening hours: 8:00am to 4:45pm, 7 days a week (except Christmas Day and Good Friday) Payment methods: Smart cards, credit card, EFTPOS, cash, account (prior approval required) and voucher are accepted. The Launceston Waste Centre (LWC) houses a recycling shed, transfer station and green waste collection area available to the public to dispose of various materials, as well as landfill and organics processing facility to accommodate municipal waste collections. The resale shop 'Uptipity', also located at LWC, is available to the public to purchase items recovered from the waste stream. Domestic quantities of permitted recyclable items can be disposed of free of charge at the facility's Recycling Centre. All other waste disposed of at the Transfer Station will incur a fee. For more information on how to sort your waste and save money and the environment, please read the Sort and Save Fact Sheets. Please note: Businesses should contact a waste contractor for recycling services. For more information concerning the disposal of hazardous waste, including asbestos, contact the Customer Service Centre on 03 6323 3000. Next to the Recycling Centre is Uptipity, a second-hand shop open 8:30 am to 4:00 pm, 7 days a week (closed Christmas day and Good Friday). The store can be contacted on 03 6326 2214 during business hours. Donations to Uptipity can be made at the Recycling Centre.
Rubbish Tip Locations - Accepted Materia: Batteries|Cars & Other Vehicles|Clothes & Textiles|Construction Material|Electronics|Furniture|Green Waste|Metals|Paper & Cardboard|Plastics|Rubber
address: JFK Access Road, Queens, Queens County, New York, 11430, United States
street: Launceston Waste Centre and Transfer Station

Title: Campbell Town Transfer Station
Content: The Northern Midlands Council recycles a range of materials at its Longford, Evandale and Campbell Town Waste Transfer Stations. Residents can dispose of recyclables at these waste transfer stations or use the kerbside recycling service. Only domestic quantities will be accepted at the transfer stations. Please note processing of recycling is half the fee of refuse disposal. A number of recycling business operate in Tasmania for information about these businesses including contact details and by type of material they collect can be found in the Recycling Near You Directory. There are two main landfill sites licensed to take Controled or non-acceptable waste. These are Port Latta in the North West and Dulverton in the North. In the south the Hobart City Council site at McRobies Gully can take limited Controlled Waste such as some medical waste and quarantine waste. In the north, the Launceston City Council at Remount Road can take small and limited quantities of Controlled Waste. It is always wise to contact the Waste Management Officers at the Department of Primary Industries, Water and Environment to ask their advise before you dispose of any Controlled Waste or if you are unsure if your waste is considered 'Controlled Waste' or not.
address: Campbell Town, Northern Midlands, Tasmania, 7210, Australia

Title: McRobies Gully Waste Management Centre
Content:
Monday to Friday 7.30 am – 4 pm
Saturday to Sunday 10 am – 4 pm
Public Holidays 10 am – 4 pm
Christmas Day, New Years Day and Good Friday Closed
The McRobies Gully Waste Management Centre (The Tip) is located at McRobies Road, South Hobart. You can contact us on 03 6238 2581. The City of Hobart is preparing for life without its own landfill, and has set a target date of 2030 to cease the operation of the landfill at McRobies Gully in South Hobart. The City has developed the Waste Management Strategy 2015-2030(PDF, 3MB) to implement significant waste reduction actions and programs with the primary aim to achieve zero waste to landfill.
address: McRobies Road, Cascades, South Hobart, Hobart, City of Hobart, Tasmania, 7008, Australia
